newsitem.title: ARGENTINA: Argentine agronomists see 12.3 mln T 1997/98 wheat.
newsitem.headline: Argentine agronomists see 12.3 mln T 1997/98 wheat.

text.p: Argentine farmers should sow about 6.2 million hectares with wheat in the 1997/98 season, and can expect to harvest 12.3 million tonnes, Argentine Agronomists Association said Thursday.

Farmers sowed 7.3 million hectares with wheat last season, harvesting a record 16.1 million tonnes, according to the government. But the association said that climatic problems and lower prices would lead to a fall in area this time round.

"The upcoming wheat campaign faces certain risks not only to do with weather but also to do with prices...as the recovery of world stocks has caused a fall in the international price of the cereal which has been felt in the local market," the association said in a statement.

The association's forecast compared with a recent prediction of a fall in wheat area of more than 10 percent by Argentina's Cereals Elevators Association and a government forecast of a fall of 5.5-12.3 percent.

The association also said it would organize an industry meeting to discuss the government's recent announcement of the creation of a new high quality wheat grade, to be marketed as "plata", which means silver in Spanish.
The government hopes greater differenciation of Argentine wheat will help improve prices.
